## Discussion

If you have an up-to-date shipping address on file, you can set this property to that address. This shipping address appears in the payment sheet. When the framework presents the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentAuthorizationViewController], the user can either keep the address you specified or enter a different address.

Note that a [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact] object that represents a shipping contact contains information for only the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/postalAddress], [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/emailAddress], and [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/phoneNumber] properties. The framework sets all other properties in the object to `nil`.

# shippingContact

**Instance Property**

A prepopulated shipping address.

## Declaration

```swift
var shippingContact: PKContact? { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you have an up-to-date shipping address on file, you can set this property to that address. This shipping address appears in the payment sheet. When the framework presents the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKPaymentAuthorizationViewController], the user can either keep the address you specified or enter a different address.

Note that a [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact] object that represents a shipping contact contains information for only the [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/postalAddress], [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/emailAddress], and [doc://com.apple.passkit/documentation/PassKit/PKContact/phoneNumber] properties. The framework sets all other properties in the object to `nil`.

## Providing known contact information

- **billingContact**: A prepopulated billing address.
- **PKContact**: An object that encapsulates contact information needed for billing and shipping.
